Articles.Content:
I blow up your hill with my super-nukes.

My great weaponized army, our planet/federation.

They arrest you for military crime.

UN's hill.

I veto it.

One stubborn member of the Security Council's hill.

Due to the veto I'm free to rule my nation again. Thanks stubborn councilman!

My nation, our planet- ah you know the rest

Oops there's a Star Destroyer

My planetary fireball

Oops there's an x-wing.

my Star destroyer fireball

Oops, there's OVER 9000 TIE fighters. controlled by me and my comrades [@DarkOwl57](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/161624-darkowl57/) [@JoseEduardo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/127759-joseeduardo/) [@SpaceplaneAddict](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149322-spaceplaneaddict/) [@Xorth Tanovar](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/71205-xorth-tanovar/) [@Murican_Jeb](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163726-murican_jeb/) [@TheEpicSquared](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/158667-theepicsquared/) and [@Atlas2342](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/155194-atlas2342/). Also we take over your base.

Our x-wing fireball and a base.
I add 1000 Griffon engine Spitfires, with extra Canadian War Thunder bias in the guns for me and my fellow comrades.

I add my space shuttle fleet armed with BD armory to the defense structures, ready to launch at any second.

our <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr> base.

You realize that BD Armory poorly works in the space, limiting you with short-range unguided weapons.

Your base surrenders. Civilization of robots takes this place.

Using EMP, I take over the robots by incinerating and reprogrammong them. And then they are guarded by a bunch of SpaceJets with lasers.

My hill with my robot friends.

I bring in the entire Minbari fleet; between the Sharlin cruisers and the Nial fighters, none of you have a chance.

My hill once again.

I subvert all of you and peacefully take the planet 'hill'.

My planet.

I trade a box of popcorn for the hill, and arm my shuttle fleet with better weapons, including exploding booster stages.

my defense structures on a hill.

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, 53miner53 said:
> 
> 
> I trade a box of popcorn for the hill, and arm my shuttle fleet with better weapons, including exploding booster stages.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> my defense structures on a hill.
> 

I use that popcorn to 'pop' all of your stuffs.

My hill.

I build my own hill, and ban wordplay.

My hill.

>

> 
> 
> I build my own hill, and ban wordplay.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> My hill.
> 

I still have my hill.

My hill.

The Empire disintegrates you. 

Our hill.

>

> The Empire disintegrates you. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Our hill.
> 

I disintegrates your empire.

My hill.

> I disintegrates your empire.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> My hill.
> 

Ah, but this is the Galactic Empire.

Still Our hill.

> 
> 
> Ah, but this is the Galactic Empire.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Still Our hill.
> 

Conquer your empire with our interstellar empire, but with superior technology.

Our hill, stop being ignorant.

> Conquer your empire with our interstellar empire, but with superior technology.
> 
>

> Our hill, stop being ignorant.

The Star Wars Galactic Empire, dope. 

Our hill still.

> 32 minutes ago, Joseph Kerman said:
> 
> 
> The Star Wars Galactic Empire, dope. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Our hill still.
> 

Trigger a vacuum metastability event and wipe out the entire Star Wars galaxy, save for the hill.

My hill.

(Note: Star Wars, along with most of today's space opera is considered very, very low tech by real standard. You don't even have turreted fighter-mounted cannon!)

I make my own hill and plant a flag on it.

my hill.

(note: Y-wings have turrets.)

> 
> 
> I make my own hill and plant a flag on it.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> my hill.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> (note: Y-wings have turrets.)
> 

Smash my hill into yours, and make my own from the leftover.

My hill.

(Even so, the battle looks incredibly inefficient even for information age battles. Ships flying extremely close to each other and spewing mysteriously slow 'laser' at each other.)
